title: Optimum Birth Month for NFL Hall of Fame Player?
question_text:
A very enthusiastic football fan wonders if there is a birth month that will give her baby the best chances of making it into the Pro Football Hall of Fame. To investigate, she conducts a hypothesis test to see if the distribution of birth months of players in the Hall of Fame is uniform across all $12\text{ months}$ of the year.
Which distribution should she use in her analysis? Why?

choices.text:
The
z
-distribution should be used because the hypothesis test is being written for a proportion.

The
z
-distribution should be used because the hypothesis test is being written to compare twelve categories.

The
t
-distribution should be used because the hypothesis test is being written to compare twelve categories.
The chi-square distribution should be used because the hypothesis test is being written for a proportion.
The chi-square distribution should be used because the hypothesis test is being written to compare twelve categories.
